dict.string: Use this section to define restrictions settings
A unique identifier for the payload, dot-delimited. Usually root PayloadIdentifier+subidentifier
The type of the payload, a reverse dns string
The version of the whole configuration profile.
This value describes the issuing organization of the profile, as displayed to the user
Disable AirDrop if set to false
Allow App Installation from Apple Configurator and iTunes
Allow only a connected Mac host to install applications
Allow App Installation from App Store
When false, the App Store is disabled and its icon is removed from the Home screen. However, users may continue to use Host apps (iTunes, Configurator) to install or update their apps.
If set to false, prevents automatic downloading of apps purchased on other devices. Does not affect updates to existing apps. Defaults to true
Allow the user to remove apps (Supervised only)

If set to false removes the Trust Enterprise Developer button in Settings->General->Profiles Device Management, preventing apps from being provisioned by universal provisioning profiles. This restriction applies to free developer accounts but it does not apply to enterprise app developers who are trusted because their apps were pushed via MDM, nor does it revoke previously granted trust. Defaults to true.
Allow the user to use the camera
Allow user access of explicit content
If set to false, changes to Find My Friends are disabled.
Allow the user to take screenshots or screen recordings

Allow Classroom or similar to observe the screen. This key should be nested beneath allowScreenShot as a sub-restriction. If allowScreenShot is set to false, it also prevents the Classroom app from observing remote screens.
Supervised only. If set to false, iBookstore will be disabled.
Supervised only. If set to false, the user will not be able to download media from the iBookstore that is tagged as erotica.
If set to false, Apple Music will be disabled in the Music app.
If set to false, Apple Music Radio is disabled.
If set to false, disabled Shared Stream.
If set to false, Wallet notifications will not be shown on the lock screen.
Supervised only. If set to false, the user is prohibited from installing configuration profiles and certificates interactively.
When false, the iTunes Music Store is disabled and its icon is removed from the Home screen. Users cannot preview, purchase, or download content.
Optional. When false, iTunes application file sharing services are disabled.
Allow apps to enter single app mode themselves.
If present, allows apps identified by the bundle IDs listed in the array to autonomously enter Single App Mode.
App Bundle ID Allowed to enter Single App Mode
App Bundle ID specified will be allowed to enter Single App Mode autonomously.
Allow the user to access and use News
Allow the user to use Safari
Allow the user to add Friends on Game Center
Allow Modifying Cellular Data Usage for Apps Settings
Allow modifying cellular data usage for apps settings
If set to false, prevents the device passcode from being added, changed, or removed. Defaults to true. This restriction is ignored by shared iPads.
Allow iCloud Sync for Managed Apps
Allow iCloud sync for managed apps
Allow enterprise books to be backed up
Allow Enterprise Books Notes and Highlights Sync
Allow enterprise books notes and highlights to be synced
Allow the user to make purchases within applications
If set to false, disables podcasts. Defaults to true.
Allow Control Center on Lock Screen
If false, prevents Control Center from appearing on the Lock screen.

If set to false, host pairing is disabled with the exception of the supervision host. If no supervision host certificate has been configured, all pairing is disabled. Host pairing lets the administrator control which devices an iOS 7 device can pair with.
Allow notifications to be displayed on the lock screen
If set to false, the Notifications view in Notification Center on the lock screen is disabled and users canâ€™t receive notifications when the screen is locked.
Allow Today view on the lock screen
If set to false, the Today view in Notification Center on the lock screen is disabled.
Allow Voice Dialing While Device is Locked
Allow voice dialing while device is locked
When false, the YouTube application is disabled and its icon is removed from the Home screen.
If set to false, disables pairing with an Apple Watch. Any currently paired Apple Watch is unpaired and erased. Defaults to true.
Allow Erase All Content and Settings
Supervised only. If set to false, the user cannot choose the option "Erase All Content and Settings" in Settings > General > Reset
If set to false, search results from the web will not be shown in Spotlight.
Allow document syncing with iCloud. When false, disables document and key-value syncing to iCloud.
Allow user to accept untrusted TLS certificates
Allow user to accept untrusted TLS certificates
Send diagnostic and usage reports to Apple
If set to false, the diagnostic submission and app analytics settings in the Diagnostics & Usage pane in Settings cannot be modified
Allow Photo Stream to be used on the device
Allow iCloud Photo Library to be used on the device
Allow iCloud Back to my Mac
Allow iCloud Back to my Mac
Allow macOS iCloud Address Book Services
Allow macOS iCloud Address Book Services
Require iTunes password for all purchases
Require the user's iTunes password to be entered for every purchase
If true, limits ad tracking. Default is false.
AirPlay requests must use a pairing password
If set to true, forces all devices receiving AirPlay requests from this device to use a pairing password.
AirPlay requests incoming must use a pairing password
If set to true, forces all devices sending AirPlay requests to this device to use a pairing password.
Two-character code for the region used to specify ratings
Accept cookies: 0 - Never, 1 - From current website only (iOS 8) or visited sites (pre-iOS 8), 1.5 - From websites I visit, 2 - Always
When false, prevents Siri from querying user-generated content from the web.
When false, prevents Siri from querying user-generated content from the web.
Allow Siri while device is locked
Enable Siri Profanity Filter (Supervised devices only)
Enable allow open from unmanaged to managed
Enable allow open from unmanaged to managed
Enable allow open from managed to unmanaged
Enable allow open from managed to unmanaged
If false, over-the-air PKI updates are disabled. Setting this restriction to false does not disable CRL and OCSP checks. Default is true.
If set to false, Handoff will be disabled.
Allow Touch ID to Unlock Device
Allow Touch ID to Unlock Device
If present, prevents bundle IDs listed in the array from being shown or launchable.
If present, allows only bundle IDs listed in the array from being shown or launchable.
If set to false, disallows macOS auto unlock. Defaults to true.
If set to false, disallows macOS cloud desktop and document services. Defaults to true.
Supervised only. If set to false, disallows dictation input. Defaults to true.
Only join WiFi through configuration profiles
Optional. Supervised only. If set to true, the device can join Wi-Fi networks only if they were set up through a configuration profile. Defaults to false.
Only join WiFi through configuration profiles

Optional. Supervised only. If set to true, and ScreenObservationPermissionModificationAllowed is also true in the Education payload, a student enrolled in a managed course via the Classroom app will automatically give permission to that course's teacherâ€™s requests to observe the studentâ€™s screen without prompting the student. Defaults to false.
upervised only. If set to false, disallow AirPrint. Defaults to true.
Supervised only. If set to false, disallows keychain storage of username and password for Airprint. Defaults to true.
Require Trusted TLS Certificates for AirPrint
Supervised only. If set to true, requires trusted certificates for TLS printing communication. Defaults to false.
Disable iBeacon discovery of AirPrint printers
Supervised only. If set to false, disables iBeacon discovery of AirPrint printers. This prevents spurious AirPrint Bluetooth beacons from phishing for network traffic. Defaults to true.
Supervised only. If set to false, disables the removal of system apps from the device. Defaults to true.
Allow the creation of VPN configurations
Supervised only. If set to false, disallow the creation of VPN configurations. Defaults to true.

This restriction allows the admin to set how many days a software update on the device will be delayed. With this restriction in place, the user will not see a software update until the specified number of days after the software update release date. The max is 90 days and the default value is 30.
Automatically allow teacher requests to join classroom
Optional. Supervised only. If set to true, automatically give permission to the teacherâ€™s requests without prompting the student. Defaults to false.
Automatically require teacher permission to leave classroom
Optional. If set to true, a student enrolled in an unmanaged course via Classroom will request permission from the teacher when attempting to leave the course. Defaults to false.
Automatically allow teacher to lock apps
Optional. Supervised only. If set to true, allow the teacher to lock apps or the device without prompting the student. Defaults to false.
Automatically allow teacher to observe screen

Optional. Supervised only. If set to true, and ScreenObservationPermissionModificationAllowed is also true in the Education payload, a student enrolled in a managed course via the Classroom app will automatically give permission to that course's teacherâ€™s requests to observe the studentâ€™s screen without prompting the student.
